details.content: The Governor's move to invite BJP to form government has triggered the Congress to file a plea in the Supreme Court on late Wednesday after which a rare midnight hearing by the three-judge bench of justice A.K. Sikri, justice S.A. Bobde and justice Ashok Bhushan was conducted that ran for hours.

With court refusing to stay the oath taking ceremony, BJP leader B. S. Yeddyurappa was sworn in as the 23rd chief minister of Karnataka on Thursday morning. Yeddyruppa took oath as planned but he has been ordered to produce the two letters dated May 15 and 16 he has written to Governor Vajubhai Vala to stake his claim for government formation.

The beleaguered Congress and Janata Dal-Secular (JD-S) leaders on Thursday protested against the swearing-in of Yeddyurappa and termed the Governor's decision "unconstitutional". The protest saw former Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, party General Secretary K.C. Venugopal and senior party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad.

The Supreme Court's decision witnessed a lot of political outburst with Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh, Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) President MK Stalin, Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee stating that the Central government has misused its power to form government in Karnataka.

The Congress and JD-S on Thursday moved their newly-elected MLAs from Eagleton resort and moved them to Hyderabad via bus, ostensibly to prevent them being poached by the BJP, which they alleged was indulging in 'horse trading' to win over their MLAs.

 Policemen deployed outside Crowne Plaza Hotel in Kochi after rumours spread about Congress-JDS MLAs from Karnataka to be shifted to Kochi on Thursday night. (EPS | Melton Antony)
HD Deve Gowda, former Prime Minister and JD(S) chief, visited Tirupati temple last night.
Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday spoke with JD(S) supremo H D Deve Gowda over phone and is understood to have discussed the prevailing political situation in Karnataka.

Speaking to the media on Thursday night, H D Kumaraswamy said, "We have to take some caution. To stop horse-trading, they(MLAs) are moving together. All MLAs(JD(S) & Congress) are travelling in the bus, they are going to stay in the same place." [FULL REPORT]

details.title: H D Devegowda offers prayers to Lord Venkateswara
details.content: Former Prime Minister H D Devegowda on Friday offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara during VIP Break Darshan. TTD DyEOs Harindranath and Balaji earlier offered traditional welcome to the Ex- Prime Minister on his arrival at the temple. (EPS)

#Hyderabad: Visuals from Park Hyatt Hotel. Congress MP from #Karnataka, DK Suresh, says, 'They (MLAs) are coming here, we are arranging everything here. We are waiting for them, in another 2 hours they will come, JD(S) and Congress both.' pic.twitter.com/CGDVINUOSU

— ANI (@ANI) May 18, 2018

I'm definite they (Karnataka JD(S) MLAs) aren't coming by flight so I'm moving to Kurnool. Not sure about destination if they come here, they're welcome. I was expecting them y'day but Civil Aviation Dept didn't give permission to charter flight: MT Thomas, Kerala JD(S) MLA & minister to ANI

Don't know where the MLAs are? They are misleading people for last 3-4 days. You will know how we will prove the majority&how many MLAs support the govt. We will respect SC's judgement, it'll have a bearing on further development of political scenario in Karnataka: B Bommai, of BJP to ANI
Mediapersons waiting for Karnataka Congress and JD (S) MLAs at Park Hyatt in Hyderabad on Friday. (EPS | R Satish Babu)

details.title: PM Modi wishes H D Devegowda on his birthday
details.content:
Spoke to our former Prime Minister Shri HD Deve Gowda Ji and conveyed birthday wishes to him. I pray for his good health and long life.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) May 18, 2018

details.title: We've the numbers, says BJP's lawyer Mukul Rohatgi
details.content: We'll show CM's letter to Court, it shows he has support and support will be shown in the house. There is no issue of horse-trading, it is the other way, as MLAs have been taken to resorts: Mukul Rohatgi, BJP's lawyer, on being asked if they have numbers he said, 'yes.
Karnataka Congress MLAs arrive at Taj Krishna Hotel in Hyderabad.
Karnaytaka Congress, JD(S) MLAs arrive at Hyderabad's Taj Krishna on Friday.

Certainly (BJP has the numbers), without that how can we form the govt?: BJP's Sadananda Gowda; on Congress MLAs being taken to Hyderabad he said, 'It is their right no? They can take them anywhere, even to Pakistan.' : ANI

Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad to ANI: MLAs who were staying at B'luru resort received threats,we wanted to take them to Kerala by air but permission was not granted,ultimately they had to travel by road. Is this democracy?No one trusts Constitution anymore, people have faith only in judiciary.
Kapil Sibal also present at Supreme Court to argue on behalf of the Congress party.

details.title: Three-judge SC bench begins hearing
details.content: Crucial hearing on Congress-JD(S) petition challenging Karnataka Governor's invitation to BJP to form govt, begins in Supreme Court.
Supreme Court asks counsels for letters from BS Yeddyurappa, Mukul Rohatgi hands over two letters of the BJP leader's letters to SC.

Karnataka elections: Mukul Rohatgi, appearing for BSY, hands over two letters of the BJP leader's letters to the Supreme Court bench @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 18, 2018

On query of bench why the letter does not have names of MLAs, Mukul Rohatgi says there was no need for BSY to give names and he is ready to prove majority on floor of House, reports TNIe's Delhi correspondent Kanu Sarda.
All MLAs are intact, threats using various govt agencies are going on but we will fight it out. We were not allowed to take a charter flight last night: DK Shivakumar, Congress in Hyderabad tells ANI

details.title: Goa Congress to meet governor
details.content: Meanwhile, Goa Congress spokerperson Yatish Naik tells ANI, "Appointment with Goa Governor at noon. We are going to tell her that since her counterpart in Karnataka has called the single largest party, she should also call us now. We are single largest party, will prove majority on the floor of the House." [FULL REPORT]

On the congress letter submitted by Abhishek Manu Singhvi, Rohatgi says the letters written by Cong-JDS does not show signs of each and every MLA declaring its support to the post poll alliance, reports TNIE's correspondent Kanu Sarda.
"We will show the numbers (majority) where it is required, why should we show the numbers in SC," Rohatgi tells bench.
On what basis the Governor decides who can provide stable government and says ultimately it is a number game, asks SC
'We have certain information that many MLAs from other parties have not given any kind of written support to Congress-JD(S),' Mukul Rohatgi tells Court

details.title: Floor test tomorrow: Justice Sikri
details.content:
Justice Sikri ask Rohtagi: An alternative is floor test and tomorrow itself, Singhvi says SC must decide who should get chance first to prove majority on floor of House @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 18, 2018

details.title: 'It's a number game'
details.content: It is just a number game, one who enjoys the majority should be invited to form the Government: Supreme Court

SC observed that as BS Yeddyurappa has claimed support and BJP is single largest party, there could be two probabilities. whether Guv's decision has to be tested or a floor test has to be held on Saturday.
In Supreme Court, Justice Arjan Kumar Sikri said, 'floor test seems to be the best option.'

Singhvi is arguing and addresses the bench as to how can Governor think that BJP can prove majority when Cong-JDS have the support of required MLAs @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 18, 2018
Yeddyurappa claimed support, but he does not have letters of support from these MLAs or it is only his oral submissions: Singhvi in SC

details.title: Singhvi says Cong-JDS is ready for floor test tomorrow but we want adequate security for our MLAs

details.content:
SC assures Singhvi that it will order DGP to make proper arrangement for floor test on Saturday @NewIndianXpress

ASG Tushar Mehta for Karnataka says the governor has not received signed letter from Congress-JD-S side
JD(S) also wants immediate floor test: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for Kumaraswamy, tells Supreme Court
Anglo-Indian member can't be nominated till the floor test is over, says Supreme Court
BJP's lawyer Mukul Rohatgi opposes floor test tomorrow, says, 'need time'.

SC also orders that Protem Speaker will decide all issues about the manner in which the floor test should be conducted @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 18, 2018

SC verdict has upheld constitutional morality&democracy. It's a judgement that should be celebrated. Faith of people in wisdom of SC is vindicated once again. It's set back for a party that wanted to usurp power:Ashwani Kumar,Congress on SC directing floor test in K'taka Assembly pic.twitter.com/2srcDuygg0

SC also restrains B S Yedyurappa from taking any major policy decisions till the floor test is conducted.

details.title: BSY remains 1-day CM: Congress
details.content:
Constitution wins, Democracy restored!#BSYeddyurappa does remain a 1 day CM - Constitution rejects an illegitimate CM as also the unconstitutional decision of Governor of Karnataka.

We welcome the Supreme Court's order. We will prove majority on the floor of the House tomorrow, we are ready for floor test: BJP leader Shobha Karandlaje to ANI

details.title: Historic verdict: Singhvi
details.content: SC has delivered a historic verdict, many important directions have been given, one of them being that floor test has to be conducted at 4 pm tomorrow under a protem speaker: Abhishek Manu Singhvi to media

details.title: Historic verdict: Singhvi
details.content:
SC has delivered a historic verdict, many important directions have been given, one of them being that floor test has to be conducted at 4 pm tomorrow under a protem speaker: Abhishek Manu Singhvi to media

 

Express photo by Shekhar Yadav

details.title: Naga People's Front demands single largest party form government in Nagaland like Karnataka
details.content: The decision Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala to invite the BJP to form Government in Karnataka as the single largest opposition party has provided ammunition to the Naga People's Front (NPF). [READ FULL REPORT]
Karnataka Governor invited BJP without establishing a majority. No governor in the history of independent India has given a party two weeks to prove majority. Maximum was one week, Azad said.

details.title: Landmark judgement in the history of the country, says former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on SC decision
details.content: Express photo by Nagaraja Gadekal

details.title: BJP's bluff called out by court: Congress President Rahul Gandhi
details.content:
Today’s Supreme Court order, vindicates our stand that Governor Vala acted unconstitutionally.

The BJP’s bluff that it will form the Govt., even without the numbers, has been called out by the court.

Stopped legally, they will now try money & muscle, to steal the mandate.

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) May 18, 2018

details.title: Missing Congress MLAs
details.content: Congress alleges that MLA Anand Singh was abducted by the Central government and Maski MLA Pratap Gowda Patil was kept in captivity.

details.title: JD(S) leader GT Devegowda reacts on floor test
details.content: "All 117 MLAs will go to assembly tomorrow and we will prove our majority. We are 100 per cent confident," GT Devagowda said.
Ahead of tomorrow's floor test in Karnataka Assembly, all recently elected BJP MLAs to meet at party office in Bengaluru today evening, reports ANI.

details.title: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra addresses media
details.content: Fearing another Goa, Congress had drafted a SC plea for the largest party to be invited first. It seems they knew that Congress would be the single largest party and they had this doubt that BJP and JD(S) would come together to form the government, Sambit Patra said.
BJP leader K S Eshwarappa on Friday expressed confidence that the BJP government headed by CM B S Yeddyurappa would prove its majority on the floor of the house on Saturday.
